Recycling Centers: Establishing easily accessible recycling centers in neighborhoods would encourage residents to recycle more effectively. This would minimize the amount of waste sent to landfills and promote the reuse of materials.
Biodegradable Packaging: Encourage businesses to use biodegradable packaging materials that can decompose naturally without harming the environment.
Waste-to-Energy Plants: Develop waste-to-energy plants that can convert non-biodegradable waste into electricity, reducing the reliance on fossil fuels and decreasing greenhouse gas emissions.
Community Clean-Up Days: Organize regular community clean-up days where residents can volunteer to pick up trash and debris in their neighborhoods.
Landfill Management: Implement better landfill management practices, such as utilizing gas capture systems to produce energy from the decomposition of waste.
